title: Race condition in with_routing integration test helper
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Hoping to get some guidance on making a consistent reproducible example. The error I'm observing (`No Failure App provided`) is occurring during `bin/rails test` and originates in the [warden gem](https://github.com/wardencommunity/warden/blob/67f5ba6baaa7564ec79afef02cf3a4d0f7d312e5/lib/warden/manager.rb#L145). This only occurs about 20% of the time, i.e., running `bin/rails test` will complete without errors 4/5 times. The error only occurs when using the `with_routing` helper, e.g., 

```ruby
class ErrorPagesConcernTest < ActionDispatch::IntegrationTest
  with_routing do |routes|
    routes.draw do
      %w[action_not_found invalid_authenticity_token name_error no_method_error record_not_found routing_error standard_error].each do |action|
        get "/default/#{action}", to: "error_pages_test##{action}"
        get "/rescued/#{action}", to: "rescued_error_pages_test##{action}"
      end
    end
  end
  
  ...
end
```

However, when I remove the `with_routing` helper and put the testing routes directly in `routes.rb`, the test suite runs without error 100% of the time.

### Expected behavior

The results of a test suit should be consistent when using the `with_routing` helper.

### Actual behavior

Using the `with_routing` helper causes inconsistent results in tests.

### System configuration

**Rails version**: 8.0.1

**Ruby version**: 3.2.6
